name: NewYorker
text: “The Victorian Kitchen Garden,” a documentary miniseries from 1987, follows a master gardener’s attempt to revive the long-fallow garden of a country estate, using entirely Victorian-era plants, tools, and methods. https://t.co/wvMLkgSfGF

name: NewYorker
text: The book “White Too Long” marshals data to lay out a startling case that “the more racist attitudes a person holds, the more likely he or she is to identify as a white Christian.” https://t.co/hp7TXDDQis

name: NewYorker
text: "This is how to love a man, and if this doesn’t work there are other ways.” Fiction by Jamaica Kincaid, from 1978. https://t.co/zFF2nmg0TD
